refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: img1=imread('path of the image file') img2=imread('path of the image file') [out1 out2] = sfind(algo_type,img1,img2) img3=imread('path of the image file') [out1 out2 out3] = sfind(algo_type,img1,img2,img3) img4=imread('path of the image file') [out1 out2 out3 out4] = sfind(algo_type,img1,img2,img3,img4) img5=imread('path of the image file') [out1 out2 out3 out4 out5] = sfind(algo_type,img1,img2,img3,img4,img5) img6=imread('path of the image file') [out1 out2 out3 out4 out5 out6] = sfind(algo_type,img1,img2,img3,img4,img5,img6)

listitem.para: an integer between 1 and 2 (both inclusive) specifying the algorithm to find seam.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The images pass through a stiching pipeline before the final panorama is formed. Features are extracted from each image and matching is done on two consecutive images to ensure the continuity in images. After this camera parameters are estimated which is required to do particular type of warping. After warping is done exposure is compensated in all images so as to get a uniform exposure throughout the panaroma. Seam estimation is done and masks will be updated.
